title: Generate QR code with all customization options
description: Verify that users can generate a QR code applying colors, dot styles, corner styles, logo upload, and watermark toggle, and that the resulting QR code visually reflects these customizations.

steps.description: Navigate to the QR code generator page
Select custom colors for QR code foreground and background
Choose dot types and corner styles from available options
Upload a logo image to embed within the QR code
Toggle watermark on
Input valid content (e.g., URL) for QR code generation
Click generate button
Confirm QR code is generated successfully and all selected customizations (colors, dots, corners, logo, watermark) are visible and correctly applied

title: Generate QR code with basic options as anonymous user
description: Validate that an anonymous (not signed-in) user can create a QR code with basic customizations and download it as PNG and SVG.

steps.description: Access the homepage as an anonymous user
Input a URL for QR code content
Use basic customization options only (color changes allowed for anonymous)
Generate the QR code
Verify QR code is generated successfully
Download QR code as PNG
Verify PNG file downloads correctly and is scannable
Download QR code as SVG
Verify SVG file downloads correctly and renders properly

title: User registration and authentication workflows
description: Ensure new users can sign up, existing users can sign in, and that sessions persist across page reloads with secure handling.

steps.description: Navigate to sign-up page
Provide valid new user details and submit registration form
Confirm registration success with automatic sign-in or redirect to sign-in page
Log out if automatically signed in
Navigate to sign-in page
Enter valid registered user credentials and submit form
Confirm successful login and access to the user dashboard
Reload the browser page
Verify that user session persists and user remains logged in

title: Dashboard QR code management and analytics
description: Verify that signed-in users can save generated QR codes, view a list of their codes, examine detailed scan analytics including scan counts and download statistics, and that all data is accurate.

steps.description: Sign in as a registered user
Generate and save a new QR code with advanced options
Navigate to user dashboard
Verify the new QR code appears in the saved codes list
Click on the QR code entry to view analytics
Confirm scan counts, download statistics, and other analytics data are displayed and accurate

title: Dynamic QR code features enforcement: expiration and scan limits
description: Test that dynamic QR codes respect expiration dates and scan limits by disabling redirection or showing error after limits are reached or after expiration.

steps.description: Create a dynamic QR code with expiration date set to past date
Scan the QR code
Verify that scanning results in an expiration message or no redirection
Create a dynamic QR code with scan limit set to 1
Scan the QR code once
Verify successful redirection or content served
Scan the QR code a second time
Verify scan limit exceeded behavior with no redirection and appropriate feedback

title: API CRUD operations on QR codes
description: Validate API endpoints for creating, updating, deleting, bulk operations, and exporting QR codes respond correctly with proper authentication and data integrity.

steps.description: Make authenticated POST request to API to create a new QR code with specified content and customization
Verify API returns created QR code details with unique ID
Make authenticated PUT request to update an existing QR code's content and styling
Verify API responds with updated QR code data reflecting changes
Make authenticated DELETE request to delete a specific QR code by ID
Ensure API confirms successful deletion and QR code no longer exists
Make bulk operation request to update or delete multiple QR codes
Verify bulk operations complete accurately with expected counts and no partial failures
Request export API to download QR code data in CSV or JSON format
Verify exported data matches user's QR code records

title: QR code scanning with analytics tracking
description: Confirm that scanning a public or dynamic QR code triggers the redirect functionality and increments scan count analytics properly.

steps.description: Locate or generate a QR code with known URL
Use a QR code scanning component or device to scan the code
Verify redirection to the correct content URL
Access user dashboard or analytics API
Confirm scan count for the QR code has incremented by one

title: URL shortening service and custom domain linking
description: Validate that URLs can be shortened and optionally linked to custom domains and that short URLs resolve correctly through QR codes and scanning.

steps.description: Generate a short URL for a given long URL using the shortening service
Confirm returned short URL is valid and unique
Assign a custom domain to a short URL through the API or user dashboard
Verify domain is assigned without errors
Scan QR code linked to the short URL and custom domain
Verify that scanning redirects correctly to the original long URL

title: Dark mode and light mode toggle
description: Check the theme toggle switches UI between dark and light modes correctly, persists user preference, and does not cause UI glitches or content loss.

steps.description: Access settings or main UI where theme toggle exists
Toggle theme from light to dark
Verify all UI components switch to dark theme colors properly with no layout or content issues
Reload the page
Verify dark mode preference persists after reload
Toggle theme back to light
Verify UI switches to light theme correctly

title: Route protection and error boundary handling
description: Verify that protected routes are accessible only to authenticated users and that error boundaries catch exceptions to show user-friendly error messages.

steps.description: Attempt to access dashboard route as an anonymous user
Confirm user is redirected to sign-in page or shown access denied message
Simulate an error in a component protected by error boundary
Verify error boundary displays user-friendly error UI with retry or navigation options
Attempt to access API endpoints without authentication
Ensure API returns 401 Unauthorized or appropriate status code

title: Watermark toggle functionality
description: Test that watermark toggling applies or removes branding from QR codes without affecting scannability or visual integrity.

steps.description: Generate a QR code with watermark toggled ON
Verify watermark is visibly present on the QR code
Scan the QR code and confirm it redirects correctly
Generate a QR code with watermark toggled OFF
Verify watermark is not present
Scan the watermark-free QR code and confirm correct redirection

title: Responsive and accessible UI verification
description: Ensure the UI components and pages adapt to different screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile) and comply with accessibility standards (keyboard navigation, ARIA attributes).

steps.description: Load the application on multiple viewport sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile)
Verify that all UI elements are correctly displayed, usable, and not clipped or overlapping
Navigate the UI using only keyboard inputs (tab, enter, space)
Confirm all interactive elements are reachable and usable via keyboard
Use accessibility audit tools to scan pages
Verify no major accessibility violations are found

title: Invalid inputs and error message handling in QR code generation
description: Test system response when users input invalid content (empty, malformed URL) or unsupported file types for logo upload ensuring correct error messages are shown.

steps.description: Attempt to generate a QR code with empty content input
Verify appropriate validation error is displayed preventing generation
Input malformed URL as content and attempt generation
Verify clear error message indicating invalid URL input
Try uploading unsupported file type (e.g., .exe) as logo
Confirm error message about invalid file type and no logo applied

title: Download QR code in multiple formats
description: Ensure QR codes can be downloaded correctly as PNG and SVG formats, and files are valid, scannable, and match current customizations.

steps.description: Generate a QR code with custom styles
Download the QR code as PNG
Verify the PNG file downloads correctly and can be opened and scanned
Download the QR code as SVG
Verify the SVG file downloads correctly, renders properly, and scans successfully
